item.title: Hacker News Top Stories: Friday, October 4, 2024 at 9:15 PM UTC
item.description:
1. Getting my daily news from a dot matrix printer (414 points | 138 comments)
2. Meta Movie Gen (650 points | 580 comments)
3. Show HN: One – A new React framework unifying web, native and local-first (267 points | 74 comments)
4. 12 Months of Mandarin (247 points | 132 comments)
5. Show HN: The Gmail unsubscribe tool with bulk deletion and personal data removal (16 points | 6 comments)
6. Carma (YC W24) Is Hiring Software Engineers to Get Fleets Same-Day Auto Repair ( | hide)
7. Show HN: Chebyshev approximation calculator (200 points | 31 comments)
8. Show HN: FFmpeg-over-IP – Connect to remote FFmpeg servers (41 points | 18 comments)
9. ESP32: leaving love notes and entering demoscene territory (2022) (96 points | 10 comments)
10. Experimental web browser optimized for rabbit-holing (483 points | 92 comments)
11. Safety Goggles for Alchemists (32 points | 12 comments)
12. Why does man print "gimme gimme gimme" at 00:30? (2017) (836 points | 355 comments)
13. How were 70s versions of games like Pong built without a programmable computer? (13 points | 3 comments)
14. Computer scientists combine two 'beautiful' proof methods (55 points | 4 comments)
15. Show HN: A tool for creating chord charts on the go (103 points | 27 comments)
16. Civilization VII recommends 16 cores and 32GB RAM for 4K gameplay (31 points | 25 comments)
17. ESP8266 Analog Broadcast Television Interface (74 points | 14 comments)
18. Upstream containers with compiler toolchains from kernel.org (4 points | discuss)
19. Show HN: kew – A Terminal Music Player for Linux (103 points | 41 comments)
20. Self-locking and stiffening deployable tubular structures (44 points | 3 comments)
21. Show HN: open source framework OpenAI uses for Advanced Voice (15 points | 2 comments)
22. Knowledge Growth and Specialization: Evidence from Oncologists (28 points | 2 comments)
23. Reverse engineering and dismantling Kekz headphones (163 points | 30 comments)
24. Manuscripts reveal the details of everyday life on the Silk Road (75 points | 16 comments)
25. Robert Dennard, DRAM Pioneer, has died (324 points | 27 comments)
26. Depth Pro: Sharp monocular metric depth in less than a second (95 points | 21 comments)
27. Were RNNs all we needed? (465 points | 243 comments)
28. Patent troll Sable pays up, dedicates all its patents to the public (1274 points | 364 comments)
29. 52 Factorial (56 points | 41 comments)
30. Why Is Light So Fast? (104 points | 101 comments)
